Candidate Name:  61927  
 
 
PERSONAL DETAILS  
  
Location:    Spain / UK  
  
 
QUALIFICATIONS  
 
BEng (Hons with DIS), Chemical Engineering with En vironmental Protection – Loughborough  University  of 
Technology  
 
Professional:  
Corporate Member of the I nstitute of Chemical Engineers (C Eng, MIChemE)  
Diploma in O ccupational Safety and He alth 
Mem ber of the Institute  of Occupational Safety and He alth (MIOSH)  
European Engineer member of The European Federation of National Engineering A ssociations (EUR Ing)  
   
Languages:  
English (Native)  
Spanish (Conversational  Proficiency )  
 
CAREER SUMMARY  
 
2018 to date  Shell – London , UK 
Position: Project and Product Manager (Contract)  
Product Manager of Shell Remote Sense: Took an I oT Service from conception to global launch, managing all 
aspects of the software development. Winning multiple awards and growing the t eam from 2 full time to over 30 
(including managing an IBM team of 10).  
 
Being a start-up and initially a small team, he had to be fully flexible and tackle whatever was priority, be that 
implementation, installation, logistics, training, testing, project management, customer relations , or sales.  
 
However  now his main role is Product Owner  and this involves all activities relating to the Product, from market 
needs sourcing and prioritisation, requirements management, product marketing and sales process through  to user 
support, training, subsequent feedback from customers and definition and designs of requirements  for the nex t 
release.  
 
2002  – 2018 DNV GL (Was Det Norske Veritas)  – London,  UK 
 
2009 – 2018  
Position: Product Manage r, Phast & Safeti Software  
• He was  managing the entire product line life cycle from strategic planning to tactical activities for  
• Phast and Safeti, world leading software tools for conse quence and risk modelling . He steered the usability of 
these technical tools to become the industry standard method f or carrying out Quantitative  Risk Assessments 
(QRA ) and ha zard analysis of onshore process,  chemical, and petrochemical facilities . Each year breaking 
records and increase market share and profitability.  
• Specifying market requirements for current and future products by conducting market research supported by 
on-going visits to customers and non -customers as well as excellent product knowledge.  
 • Driving a solution set across development teams (primarily Development  / Engineering, and Marketing 
Communications)  
• Developing and implementing a vision, road map, scope , and design by working with all departments to 
execute. Using Agile and Lean (minimum viable product) development techniques.  
• Analyzing potential partner relationships for the product . 
• Implementing Software as a service to reach a wider market.  
• Conducting User conferences and training worldwide  
 
2002 – 2009  
Position: Technica l Support  Engineer  
Returned to the company  in the Technical Support t eam assuming the  role he held between 1997 and 1998.  
 
2000 – 2002 Carp hone Warehouse  
Position : Business Analy st 
Responsible for propo sing, justifying,  and implementing  projects in to the business, focusing on mobile  virtual 
network for Financi al times.  
 
1997 – 2000  DNV GL (W as Det Norske Veritas ) 
 
1998 – 2000  
Position: Risk Consultant  
Performed numerous quantitative risk analyses for a variety of clients (Shell, Petronas, ESSO, BP, UK 
Environmental Agency, and Tera Nova Alliance) using variety of different software tools us ing Phase and Safeti.  
 
1997 – 1998  
Position:  Technical Support Engineer  
Engineer for Det Norske Veritas, S AFETI division, in a Technical Support role for their Hazard and Risk software 
(Phast, Safeti, NEPTUNE, SUMMIT, DNV -pro, and CARA). Work included delivering training, support on both IT 
and modelling issues encountered  when using the software, and testing o f new software releases.  
 
1995 – 1997 Johnson Matthey  
Position: Safety Engineer  
He was responsible for all aspects of Health and Safety on the major accident hazard chemical facili ty.  
 
COMMENTS  
 
Executive Profile:  
 
* Product Manager     * Busine

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
